title: [推到國際女權] 記者被指罵「雞」「慰安婦」，集會召集人要負責

replies.msg:
立場記者姐姐比廢老鬧做雞
https://lih.kg/1268764

香港攝影記者協會
香港記者協會
聯合聲明(節錄)

在立法會議員入口2號外，一名女子拍打眾新聞攝影記者的鏡頭，現場記者表名身份後，該名集會人士再用腳踢中蘋果日報攝影記者的攝錄機以及另一名文字記者，最後由現場警察帶走。

立場新聞一名實習記者在立法會示威區被集會人士辱罵「做雞」，該記者已多次表明記者身份，集會人士仍繼續辱罵，更向在場其他記者挑釁，及後更有一名示威者向現場記者吐口水，然後匆忙逃去。

/

https://www.facebook.com/standnewshk/videos/2368462710089098?sfns=mo
3:00 開始睇
男人:「個個都係慰安婦，個個都係雞」

/

推上國際女權 同南韓 個邊
要求撐警集會召集人 何君堯解釋
點解集會嘅參加者可以稱呼 記者為「雞」「慰安婦」

香港記者協會
聯合聲明(節錄)

在立法會議員入口2號外，一名女子拍打眾新聞攝影記者的鏡頭，現場記者表名身份後，該名集會人士再用腳踢中蘋果日報攝影記者的攝錄機以及另一名文字記者，最後由現場警察帶走。

立場新聞一名實習記者在立法會示威區被集會人士辱罵「做雞」，該記者已多次表明記者身份，集會人士仍繼續辱罵，更向在場其他記者挑釁，及後更有一名示威者向現場記者吐口水，然後匆忙逃去。

/

replies.msg:
To Whom it may concern,

On 30th June 3pm, a Hong Kong Legislative Councilor Mr. Junius Ho Kwan-yiu, has organized an assembly aimed to support Hong Kong Police at Tamar Park, Central. To my concern, during the event some participants have violently destroyed banners and condolence messages dedicated to the martyr sacrificed his life during the previous anti-extradition bill protests. Press from all over the world were also attacked with insulting foul languages, mud and spit, with their camera damaged. A councilor from opposition party was also beaten by several participants and was gravely wounded. Whats more infuriating was some female reporters, with their reporter card shown visibly, were insulted with "prostitute", "comfort women" (A term referring to women and girls forced into sexual slavery). As a Hong Kong citizen, we strongly believe in Universal value such as Press freedom and Gender Equality, and would not tolerate such savagery act. We strongly urge the organizer, Mr. Junius Ho Kwan-yiu, to clarify the events I have mentioned. Thank you for your attention. Attached please find videos as evidence.

To Whom it may concern,

On 30th June 3pm, a Hong Kong Legislative Councilor Mr. Junius Ho Kwan-yiu, has organized an assembly aimed to support Hong Kong Police at Tamar Park, Central. To my concern, during the event some participants have violently destroyed banners and condolence messages dedicated to the martyr sacrificed his life during the previous anti-extradition bill protests. Press from all over the world were also attacked with insulting foul languages, mud and spit, with their camera damaged. A councilor from Democratic party, Mr. Lam Cheuk Ting, was also beaten by several participants and was gravely wounded. Whats more infuriating was some female reporters, with their reporter card shown visibly, were insulted with "prostitute", "comfort women" (A term referring to women and girls forced into sexual slavery). As a Hong Kong citizen, we strongly believe in Universal value such as Press freedom and Gender Equality, and would not tolerate such savagery act. We strongly urge the organizer, Mr. Junius Ho Kwan-yiu, to clarify the events I have mentioned. Thank you for your attention. Attached please find videos as evidence.

To Whom it may concern,

I am writing to express concern on a recent event organized by a Hong Kong Legislative Councilor where his supporters openly destroys Hong Kong's freedom of speech, press and gender equality.

On 30th June 3pm, the Hong Kong Legislative Councilor Mr. Junius Ho Kwan-yiu, has organized an assembly aimed to support Hong Kong Police at Tamar Park, Central. To my concern, some participants have violently destroyed banners and condolence messages dedicated to the citizen sacrificed his life during the previous anti-extradition bill protests.

Press from all over the world were also attacked with insulting foul languages, mud and spit, with their camera damaged. Another councilor from Democratic party, Mr. Lam Cheuk Ting, was also beaten by several participants and was gravely wounded.

Whats more infuriating was some female reporters, with their reporter card shown visibly, were verbally abused with "prostitute", "comfort women" (A term referring to women and girls forced into sexual slavery).

As a Hong Kong citizen, we strongly believe in Universal value such as Press freedom and Gender Equality, and would not tolerate such savagery act. We strongly urge the organizer, Mr. Junius Ho Kwan-yiu, to clarify the events I have mentioned. Thank you for your attention.

Attached please find videos as evidence.

A 《The Stand News》female press was sweared " prostitute", "Comfort woman" by a group of pro-Hong Kong police protesters yesterday.

The protesters joined a public meeting. At the same time, anti-chinese extradition protesters appeared for showing pictures of police violence. A conflicted was started at the protest area in Legislative Council Complex. Presses wear safety vest to show the identity. However, they were still sweated by the pro-police protesters.

The meeting was held by Legislative Council member Junius Ho Kwan-yiu. The organizer claimed over 160,000 protesters joined the meeting.
